strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_low>King Trode: When you all got caught in that avalanche, I hurried over to this hut for help. I was in quite a panic, I must admit.
<se_low>King Trode: My heart sank when I found out there was just an old lady living here on her own.
<se_low>King Trode: But as luck would have it, that dog over there is a dab hand when it comes to pulling people out of the snow. Or should I say a dab paw!?
<se_low>King Trode: Anyway, he pulled you all out and we managed to get you back to the hut here.
<se_low>King Trode: I suppose you could say he played a part in your rescue.<page>King Trode: But if I hadn't come here in the first place, you'd still be eating snow. I do hope you're grateful!
<se_low>King Trode: You really are a luckless bunch getting caught up in an avalanche like that, though.<page>King Trode: Maybe it's punishment for always being so badly behaved.
<se_low>King Trode: After all, the Princess and I somehow managed to escape it even though we were with you.<page>King Trode: I suppose it's because there's not a bad bone in our bodies.
<se_low>King Trode: We wouldn't know how to get up to no good even if we wanted to!
<se_low>*: Ah, you are awake! Hm... You have a nice colour in your cheeks. It is a good sign.
<se_low>*: Dobro pozhalovat! Welcome to my home. I am Marta. I live out here in the mountains where I grow herbs.
<se_low>Marta: This will be ready for you soon. Drinking it should warm you up nicely.
<se_low>Yangus: How yer feelin', guv? You awright?
<se_low>Yangus: I was worried about ya, like. You was the only one who wouldn't wake up.
<se_low>Yangus: This place belongs to that old granny over there. Lives 'ere on 'er own, y'know.
<se_low>Yangus: We're not far from where that av'lanche 'appened. She says we can stay 'ere 'til the snow clears up a bit.
<se_high>Jessica: This tea's made from something called ‘nook grass’. It warms you up and makes you more resistant to the cold weather.
<se_high>Jessica: It's a bit strong at first, but I could get to like it! Why don't you ask the old lady for some too, <hero>?
<se_low>Marta: Oh! You are back again! Did you get lost on your way to Orkutsk?
<se_low>Marta: Dear me!
<se_low>Marta: All you have to do is go down the mountain and travel to the north. Try not to get lost this time!
<se_low>Marta: Then perhaps you are just tired of walking in the mountains? You are not used to them, after all.
<se_low>Marta: If you wish, you can rest in the room next door. There are always beds for you here.
<se_low>Marta: Goodness! What are you doing walking about so late at night?
<se_low>Marta: If you are tired, you are welcome to rest here. Whatever you are doing can wait until tomorrow.
<se_low>Marta: Oh! You are back! Did you meet with Marek?
<se_low>Marta: You did? Wonderful! Spasibo! I was right to ask you for help.
<se_low>Marta: Did he perhaps say anything about the bag I sent for him...?
<se_low>Marta: No, never mind that. As long as I know he is well, I do not need to know more.
<se_low>Marta: But he should have been there! You say he has gone missing!?
<se_low>Marta: This is not good. Where can he have gone? Why must he always cause me such worry...?
<se_low>Boris: Av av av!
<se_low>Boris: R-r-r... Gav gav!
<se_low>Marta: I knew I recognised you! You are the ones who were caught in the avalanche, no?
<se_low>Marta: You seem to have more than your share of bad luck, turning up here at a time like this...
<se_low>Marta: Still, we must look on the bright side. Perhaps it is a good thing that you found your way into the ruin.
<se_low>Marta: I was downstairs infusing herbs when I heard Boris barking up above.
<se_low>Marta: When I went to see what was bothering him, I found a group of wolves surrounding the house! I ran in here to get away from them.
<se_low>Marta: I only saw them briefly, but I am sure they were not normal wolves.
<se_low>Marta: I could sense some kind of evil about them...
<se_low>Marta: I wonder, did you meet with Marek and pass on the bag I gave you?
<se_low>Marta: I cannot believe it! He is coming here because he is worried about me?
<se_low>Marta: I always thought I was the only one, with all my worries about him. My Marek...
<se_low>Marta: So he did not take the bag from you?
<se_low>Marta: ...Oh. Well, if he sees my help as a hindrance, then I suppose there is nothing I can do.
<se_low>Marta: The time has come. I cannot cower in here forever.
<se_low>Marta: I must confront this evil, for better or for worse.
<se_def>Marek: Mama... Our friends will avenge your death, I promise you.
<se_def>Marek: You say the evil dog flew off to the east, yes? In the direction of the Lord High Priest's island?
<se_def>Marek: With Empyrea's help, you will be able to chase him no matter how far he flies.
<se_def>Marek: You should look around the ruin and read the inscriptions on the monuments. They will tell you more about the legendary Empyrea.
<se_low>Boris: R-r-r...
<se_def>Marek: Stay inside, mama... Stay inside...
<se_def>*: Grr! GRRRRRR!
There is no response. It seems she has breathed her last.
<se_low>Boris: Gav gav gav!
<se_def>Marek: Ah, <leader>! I do not expect to see you all the way out here! Is everything all right?
<se_def>Marek: ...This is true!? You have really defeated the evil dog?
<se_def>Marek: ...I am speechless with gratitude. Now my mother can rest in peace at last.
<se_def>Marek: Ah, yes! There is something I want to give you. It can in no way repay you for all you have done, but it is a small token of my thanks.
<se_def>Marek: It is not easy to prepare, but I am sure you will find some use for it.
<Cap><leader> receives four bunches of nook grass and puts them in the bag.
<se_def>Marek: Ah, <leader>! I do not expect to see you all the way out here!
<se_def>Marek: Do you think that what happened to the sky was something to do with the evil dog?
<se_def>Marek: You know, I have been reading the monuments about the Godbird Empyrea since I was a child.
<se_def>Marek: I have some idea of what must be going on in the world now.
<se_def>Marek: And of what it is you must be doing to stop it... We are all depending on you, <leader>!
<se_def>Marek: For my part, I am doing everything in my power here to put my herbs to good use.
<se_def>Marek: We must all do what we can in our own ways. Together it is possible to break even an elm!
<se_low>Boris: Av...
<se_low>Morrie: Ragazzo! You are with us again! When I decide to come with you on this avventura, I was not expecting snow, ay? And for sure, not the avalanches!
<se_low>Morrie: At the first, I was worried, but then I think maybe it's my licky day, ay? To have the bella donna come to our salvation!
